option_phrases.phrase: I feel very secure in my job — I'm not worried about losing it
My job feels mostly stable, though nothing's guaranteed
I have some real concerns about my job security
I'm genuinely worried I could lose my job soon
Job security isn't something I think about — I'm not in the workforce right now

phrasings.null_phrase: Job security isn't something I think about — I'm not in the workforce right now

option_phrases.phrase: I have a solid savings cushion and feel financially stable
I have some savings, but not a lot of room for unexpected expenses
I'm basically living paycheck to paycheck with little left over
I'm carrying more debt than I can comfortably manage — I'm in the red
I don't have any investments or market accounts
My only investments are a retirement account like a 401k or IRA
I have a diversified portfolio across stocks, bonds, and other assets beyond just retirement accounts
I actively trade stocks or other securities on a regular basis
I hold cryptocurrency as part of my financial strategy

phrasings.null_phrase: I don't have any investments or market accounts

option_phrases.phrase: I get most of my news from cable or broadcast television
Social media is where I mostly find out what's going on in the world
I mainly follow the news through websites and digital news outlets
Podcasts are my main way of staying informed
I rely mainly on local TV, radio, or newspapers for my news
I still primarily read print newspapers or magazines to stay informed
Honestly, I try to tune out the news as much as possible

phrasings.null_phrase: Honestly, I try to tune out the news as much as possible

option_phrases.phrase: I don't use social media at all
I scroll through social media but rarely post or comment
I post on social media sometimes, but I'm not super active
I post regularly and engage heavily on social media — building or maintaining an audience is part of how I operate

phrasings.null_phrase: I don't use social media at all

option_phrases.phrase: I actively avoid new technology whenever I can — it's not for me
I wait until a technology is well-established and widely used before I bother with it
Once I see that something works and people around me are using it, I'm willing to try it
I tend to get into new technology pretty early — I like staying ahead of the curve
I'm usually among the very first to try cutting-edge technology — I love being at the frontier
I don't practice any religion and don't consider myself religious
I loosely identify with a religion but don't really practice it
Faith plays a meaningful role in my life, though I'm not strictly observant
My faith is central to who I am and shapes how I live my life

phrasings.null_phrase: I don't practice any religion and don't consider myself religious

option_phrases.phrase: I'm a committed Democrat — I strongly identify with the party and its values
I generally lean Democratic, though I don't think of myself as a hardcore partisan
I'm genuinely independent — I don't align with either party
I tend to lean Republican, though I'm not a die-hard party loyalist
I'm a committed Republican — I strongly identify with the party and its values
I really don't follow politics closely — it feels distant from my daily life
There's one issue that drives almost all of my political engagement
I pay attention to politics and vote, but I'm not deeply involved beyond that
I'm very politically active — I follow politics closely and do more than just vote

phrasings.null_phrase: I really don't follow politics closely — it feels distant from my daily life

option_phrases.phrase: I voted for Donald Trump in the 2024 presidential election
I voted for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election
I voted for a third-party candidate in the 2024 presidential race
I didn't vote in the 2024 presidential election
I wasn't eligible to vote in the 2024 presidential election

phrasings.null_phrase: I didn't cast a ballot in the 2024 presidential race

option_phrases.phrase: I vote in every midterm election — it's something I always do
I vote in midterms sometimes, depending on how much I care about what's on the ballot
I rarely vote in midterm elections — it doesn't usually feel worth it
I don't vote in midterm elections
My congressional district is solidly Republican — there's no real competition
My district tilts Republican, but it's not a total lock
I live in a genuine swing district where either party could win
My district tends to go Democratic, though it's not completely safe
My congressional district is solidly Democratic — the outcome is pretty predictable
The economy and jobs are the issues I care most about going into 2026
Abortion and reproductive rights are my top concern for the 2026 elections
Immigration is the issue driving my vote more than anything else in 2026
Protecting democracy and the rule of law is my single biggest priority for 2026
Healthcare — its cost and access — is what I care about most heading into 2026
Climate change is the issue I'm most focused on for the 2026 elections
Education policy is the issue I care most about as we head into 2026
The regulation and impact of AI and new technology is my top concern for 2026
I strongly approve of the direction the country is headed right now
I think things are generally moving in the right direction, even if not perfectly
I'm not happy with the direction the country is going, though it's not all bad
I strongly disapprove of the direction this country is headed — things are going very wrong
I tend to stick with the brands I trust — I'm not constantly switching
Price and value for money are what drive my buying decisions more than anything else
I try to buy from companies whose ethics and values align with mine, even if it costs more
Convenience is king for me — I buy whatever is easiest and fastest
I generally trust major institutions — government, media, science, and corporations — to act in good faith
I have moderate trust in institutions — I believe in them but know they're flawed
I have pretty low trust in most major institutions — I think they frequently let people down
I deeply distrust most major institutions and believe a lot of what we're told is manipulated or hidden from us
I don't have a particular personal or family health reason to care about medical breakthroughs
I'm generally interested in medical advances, though nothing urgent personally drives that interest
I or someone close to me is managing a serious chronic illness, so medical breakthroughs matter a lot to us
I or a family member has a terminal or degenerative diagnosis — medical breakthroughs could be genuinely life-or-death for us

phrasings.null_phrase: I don't have a particular personal or family health reason to care about medical breakthroughs

option_phrases.phrase: I see advanced AI as an existential threat to humanity — this could go very badly for all of us
I think advanced AI poses serious risks and society needs to take those dangers much more seriously
I'm cautiously optimistic about advanced AI — I see real benefits, but also real risks that need managing
I'm excited about what advanced AI can do — I think the benefits far outweigh the risks
Honestly, I'm not sure what to think about advanced AI — I haven't formed a strong view either way

phrasings.null_phrase: Honestly, I'm not sure what to think about advanced AI — I haven't formed a strong view either way

option_phrases.phrase: Most of what I do for work could realistically be automated by AI — I'm in a high-risk position
Some of my work could be taken over by AI, though I don't think I'd be fully replaced
My work is physical or deeply relational in ways that are hard to automate — I feel fairly insulated from AI displacement
AI or automation has already disrupted my career or cost me work
I'm not currently employed, so job displacement from AI isn't something I'm facing right now

phrasings.null_phrase: I'm not currently employed, so job displacement from AI isn't something I'm facing right now

option_phrases.phrase: I'm already using advanced AI tools heavily in my daily life or work
I plan to start integrating AI tools into my life or work pretty soon
I'm curious about AI tools but haven't committed to using them — I'm still on the fence
I'm resistant to using AI tools, but I can see that I might not have a choice for long
I'm actively choosing not to use AI tools and intend to keep it that way
I think AI should be left alone to develop without government interference
I prefer the industry regulate itself with minimal government involvement
I support reasonable government oversight of AI to manage risks without strangling innovation
I think AI needs strong international regulation and coordination to prevent catastrophic misuse
I believe development of the most powerful AI systems should be paused until we can prove it's safe
I generally take information at face value without digging into whether it's accurate
I stick to a handful of sources I trust and don't feel the need to verify beyond that
When something seems important, I check it against multiple sources before I accept it as true
I actually use AI tools to help me verify and fact-check information I come across
I'm skeptical of almost everything I read or hear — I trust very little of what's out there
I strongly support bold redistribution policies — things like UBI, wealth taxes, or public ownership of AI — to make sure everyone benefits
I support some redistribution to share the gains from AI more broadly, even if I don't go as far as full public ownership
I think the market should determine who benefits from AI — redistribution creates more problems than it solves
I'm opposed to redistribution — government taking and reallocating wealth is fundamentally wrong to me
I genuinely haven't made up my mind about how the benefits of AI should be distributed across society

phrasings.null_phrase: I genuinely haven't made up my mind about how the benefits of AI should be distributed across society

option_phrases.option: Very concerned - sees it as primary threat
option_phrases.phrase: The US-China race on AI is what I see as the most serious geopolitical threat we face right now
I'm somewhat concerned about AI competition with China and its national security implications
The geopolitics of AI is on my radar, but it's not something I worry about deeply
I'm not particularly concerned about US-China AI competition — it doesn't feel like a major issue to me
I actually think competition between the US and China on AI will drive better outcomes for everyone
I believe the AI milestones and breakthroughs we're hearing about are real and credible
I think most of what's being claimed about AI advances is genuine, even if details get spun
I think a lot of the AI breakthrough news is overhyped and the reality is more mundane than advertised
I'm skeptical that what we're being shown about AI is real — I think some of it is staged or manipulated for political or commercial purposes
I honestly haven't been following the news about AI milestones closely enough to have an opinion

phrasings.null_phrase: I honestly haven't been following the news about AI milestones closely enough to have an opinion
